Why Did God Take My Daddy From Me?

Updated June 25, 2020

#Sadness   #Death   #Comfort

â€œWhy did God take him?â€ The girl yelled, â€œWhy is he gone? Why would God take my Daddy from me?â€ She sobbed. â€œHow can this part of Godâ€™s plan for me?â€

She could still see her Daddyâ€™s face smiling at her. She could still feel him holding her hand.

â€œOh the times we shared and the fun we had, why did God take my Daddy from me?â€ She thought. â€œIf I could ask Him one thing today it would be why is my Daddy not home with me?â€

With tear-stained eyes she looked to the heavens, â€œTell me God why did you take him from me!â€ The girl lowered her head and sobbed in her hands. â€œTell meâ€¦ pleaseâ€¦ tell meâ€¦ whyâ€¦â€

â€œChild,â€ a voice called, â€œchild look at me.â€

The girl slowly glanced up at the stranger and gasped at his face. It couldnâ€™t be! No, she was dreaming, it has to be.

The man smiled and sat down beside her, â€œTell me, did you truly want your father to stay?â€

The girl looked into Godâ€™s kind eyes and silently replied, â€œYes Lord, I loved him so much.â€

â€œDo you not think I loved him too? Do you not think I missed him too?â€

â€œNo, butâ€¦â€

â€œChild, did you not see that your father was suffering? Did you not see his pain? If you had the power to end it all wouldnâ€™t you? Would you not give him the peace he desired?â€

The girl lowered her head and thought carefully, â€œNo, I would have given it to him no matter the cost.â€

God smiled at her, â€œThen, you are beginning to understand. I took him because his time was up, he had lived his life and was ready to go. I did not take him because I hated you and wished to hurt you. I took him to give you and him peace and happiness.â€

â€œBut I do not feel peace or happiness!â€ she cried out, â€œI feel empty.â€

â€œThat, my child, is because you loved him and havenâ€™t let him go.â€ He lifted her chin to meet His eyes, â€œLet him go, my child, so you can heal. Let him go so that you both can be truly happy. He is happy, my dear, and wishes you to be too. Be happy for him because he is finally healed. He is jumping and laughing, smiling and dancing. There is no better place for him than with Me in Paradise.â€

Tears sprang to her eyes again. She knew He was right but just couldnâ€™t get past the pain, â€œHelp me let go, I want to be happy for him butâ€¦â€

The Lord smiled and softly caressed her face, â€œI can help you, my child, but it takes time and I canâ€™t do it for you. You must learn to let go or your sorrow will kill you. It is hard for me too, seeing you here and crying. But it was for the best, I could not wait any longer. Know that he is happier than before. Know that he is waiting for you to be happy too. Do not mourn those who have gone to a better place, for you will join them too and see their face. Do not cry, instead rejoice! Rejoice for he has made it to Paradise.â€

The girl smiled through the tears, â€œI will Lord, I will.â€

â€œGood, my child, now help those around you to do the same. Nothing good comes from sorrow, it only brings pain.â€

She nodded, â€œThank you Lord for comforting me and answering my cry. I know You know whatâ€™s best for me, even through the pain you are shaping me to be prepared for what the future brings.â€

God smiled and pressed a kiss on her head. Then, he stood and looked at her again, â€œNever forget this my child: I will always love you and comfort you during your pain. Just call My name and I will always be there.â€

She nodded and smiled, feeling the pain lessen. It was still there, but it no longer choked her and it was easier to bare.

God glanced at her one last time. Then, He raised His hand and disappeared in a flash of light.

The girl again looked up to the heavens, but no longer did she cry. Instead, she smiled and thanked God for His gift in disguise.

Written by Bravisha Skietano

I'm an eighteen-year-old, homeschooled, Christian student who is struggling to stay motivated and finish things. I love Jesus, pretty much any yarn crafts (crochet, knitting, macrame, been there done that), reading, writing, horses, developing websites (new at that), FOSS, and anything Linux (I'm not a complete tech geek but I definitely see myself getting there blush).

I'm very social, which isn't a very good thing since I trust people too easily wink, but I'm getting better. I open my mouth a lot before thinking, but as I said, I'm getting better. I procrastinate way too much but prayerfully I will learn some self-control and apply it everywhere in my life (starting with my mouthğŸ˜‹).
